result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R Roach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Utility's Property, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with exhibit number one.
marked number one, certified copy of bond from 12CF36.

Defendant Charles R Roach in court with attorney Erika Bahnson.  Defendant Charles R Roach in custody.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 12CF36, motion to revoke DAGP, 12CM57,12CM58 Sentencing hearing on revocation.  

14CF53-State calls Investigator Riley Kummet, oath given.  Direct by the State. State files a certified copy of bond from case #12CF36, court will receive.   Cross by Defense.  Witness dismissed.  The court will find probable cause, will bind over for JT.  State files information this day in court.  Atty requests additional time before arraignment.  Set for 9-29-14 @ 2:00PM.  State requests a $10,000.00 cash bond, no contact with the child EKP-dob 12-17-10.  Atty requesting a sign bond, State opposes, believes a high cash bond in necessary.  DE would reside with his mother if released.  State would not object to huber release.  The court will release on a  $5000.00 sign bond, must obtain employment within 30 days, must reside with his parents, no contact with ERP-dob 12/17/10 or Katrina Bauspies. 
12CM57-12CM58- Court will sentence to 6 months jail on each count, concurrent, has credit for 162 days, reduce any unpaid fines/restitution to a civil judgment.  Will be released today with credit or good time.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court informs on waiver of prelim hearing, court will accept waiver.  12CF36-motion to terminate DAGP.  Track cases together.
